metadata.Title: CVE-2023-3347 on Ubuntu 18.04 LTS (bionic) - medium
metadata.Description: A vulnerability was found in Samba's SMB2 packet signing mechanism. TheSMB2 packet signing is not enforced if an admin configured "server signing= required" or for SMB2 connections to Domain Controllers where SMB2 packetsigning is mandatory. This flaw allows an attacker to perform attacks, suchas a man-in-the-middle attack, by intercepting the network traffic andmodifying the SMB2 messages between client and server, affecting theintegrity of the data.

criterions.comment: samba: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
